p: When plotting the IC 50 values (log scale) of the inhibitors against M pro from the FRET enzymatic assay with the melting temperature shifts (ΔT m) from TSA (Fig. 3a), a linear correlation was observed, and the r 2 of the linear regression fitting is 0.94. This suggests that there is a direct correlation between the enzymatic inhibition and protein binding: a more potent enzyme inhibitor also binds to the protein with higher affinity. The stabilization of the M pro against thermal denaturation was also compound concentration dependent (Fig. 3b).
